chapter.title: Configuration
chapter.para: The following sections will guide you through the configuration and setup of the website project itself and how to locally launch it in your pre-prepared environment of the previous chapter.

section.title: Configure the project
section.para:
The root folder of the project will present you with the following folder hieararchy:
cart/
djangocart/
docs/
product/
simple_shop/
.gitignore
README.md
manage.py
pip-requirements.txt
Please change into simple_shop and create a copy of settings_local.local with the name settings_local.py.

note.title: Editor of choice
note.para: The last line with vi settings_local.py is just an example. Please use your editor of choice for editing the python file.

section.para: Most varaibles in the settings_local.py will already be as they are needed. The only part which needs to be filled in will be SECRET_KEY.

important.title: SECRET_KEY is required for the project to run!
important.para: SECRET_KEY is used in many security related places within the django framework and should never be shared nor exposed. Here is an example of a secret key (don't use for productive use): 6*kpa+0m+%k(d-$_xbh#b7zch1_9ox0!35a^@q4fv=i*p!4*to

section.title: Create the database
section.para: Change into the root folder of simple-shop if you have not already and execute python manage.py migrate. This will setup the database hierarchy and tables.

After the database is created, you can import the initial data with python manage.py loaddata data. This creates all product and category entries in the database, including an superuser called admin and password admin.
The information asked will consist out of username, email address, password.

important.title: Make sure your virtual environment is active!
important.para: In order to execute the manage.py script you'll have to have your environment active with the right python version, otherwise you'll encounter potential issues / errors.

section.title: Compile the LessCSS
section.para: The project is using LessCSS to write less CSS and align the CSS more with well structured code. There are a multitude of LessCSS compilers out there which can be used to compile the style.less in simple_shop/media/css/.

note.title: In case you can't compile

section.title: Start the webapplication
section.para: When you finished the configuration, please execute python manage.py runserver and head over to http://localhost:8000 in your browser of choice.
The admin panel is accessible under http://localhost:8000/admin/. The username and password when you used the initial data is "admin".
